intro: Swertia albicaulis var. modocensis, commonly known as Modoc mountain gentian, is a perennial herb native to the high elevations of the Sierra Nevada in California. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats and has lance-shaped leaves with a bluish-green hue. Its flowering stems are usually unbranched and bear clusters of small, tubular flowers. This variety is notable for its adaptability to alpine conditions and its role in supporting local pollinators.
